title: How many ways can a student answer the 10 true or false questions if the student answers 2 of the questions false and the rest with true (2 false and 8 true)? - Quora

response.answer_text: He or she has 10 possible choices for the first 'false' answer and 9 for the second, but then we count each pair twice, so in total there are 45 ways of distributing the 2 false answers. And of course there is no further choice over which answers will be marked 'true'.

How many ways can a student answer the 10 true or false questions if the student answers 2 of the questions false and the rest with true (2 false and 8 true)? The formula is (102)=45(102)=45 To decide which 2 questions he answers with false. Binomial coefficient - Wikipedia
So; I assume we are not concerned if any of the answers are wrong. 10!/(2!*8!) 3,628,800/2*40,320 45
